intro: Liuguishania taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan liuguishania, is a rare flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountainous regions. Its botanical features include hairy stems and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
